alert.note: Alert for Central Arctic Plains (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 05 at 12:59AM AKST until January 05 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Central Arctic Plains north of Sagwon. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST early this morning. * IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult. Blowing snow will cause whiteout conditions. Large snow drifts will form. Wind chills to 50 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The strongest winds and lowest visibility is north of Sagwon. Winds will decrease this morning and visibility is expected to improve then above 1 mile this morning.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely difficult. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
